definition: foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort

sentences.english: He has a far off friend who lives in America.
sentences.chinese: 他有個住在美國的番邦同伴。

sentences.english: In foreign country the people mention the bat thinks of the ugly image.
sentences.chinese: 在番邦，們提到蝙蝠，就想到醜惡兇惡的景。

sentences.english: He has a different friend who lives in America.
sentences.chinese: 他有個住在美國的番邦同伴。

sentences.english: Many people choose to live in overseas, which has turned on greto concern.
sentences.chinese: 許多人選擇住在番邦，這引起了極大的眷注。

sentences.english: Your price is$500/mt! twice of the other countries.
sentences.chinese: 你們每公噸500美圓的價錢是另番邦度的兩倍。

sentences.english: There are two foreigners in the office.
sentences.chinese: 辦公室裏有兩個番邦人。

definition: common term for non-Han peoples in former times, not exclusively derogatory/barbarian
Western Regions (Han Dynasty term for regions beyond Yumen Pass 玉門關|玉门关[Yu4 men2 Guan1])
Korean Goryeo dynasty, 918-1392/Korea, esp. in context of art and culture
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
the Indian subcontinent (esp. in Tang or Buddhist context)
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
